summary: John the Dee Jay is an individual who attracted the attention of counter-intelligence in Datteln, Federal Republic of Germany, in February and March 1972. He is described as displaying unusual interest in military personnel, installations, and equipment, and attempting to elicit official information from members of the 66th USA Artillery Detachment. He made a nuisance of himself at a bar, asking about security information. His activities prompted multiple agent reports and a message from the 66th MI GP to DCSI USAREUR, leading to a counter-intelligence investigation and an interview with a custodial agent.
significance: The provided documents do not indicate any connection to the JFK assassination. John the Dee Jay appears to be a person of interest to counter-intelligence due to his suspicious behavior and inquiries regarding military security in Germany during 1972.
